title: Your Fave Unicase Fonts, addendum
content:
Whoops, [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/show.pl?30/49074) slipped by so fast I didn't see it, and   
now I noticed nobody mentioned my favourite unicase   
designs. [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html), in itself a beautiful and very forward-   
thinking serif face, has a great unicase weight [Omni](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PEidOm.html).   
   
Also, both Emigre's [Platelet](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PPlaR.html) and [Democratica](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PDemR.html) have capitals   
that are x-height sized, so they lend themselves perfectly to   
unicase setting.   
   
And I know this is probably stretching it a bit thin, but   
combining [Mrs. Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PMrsR.html) lowercase with the [Petite Capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804183130/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PMrsP.html)   
- smaller than the Small Caps and also x-height sized -   
allows one to set unicase as well.
author: Bald Condensed
